intro: Sorengia longifolia subsp. combsii, commonly known as the Combs' longleaf sorengia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, often in areas with well-drained soils. Its leaves are elongated and often have a slight pubescence, while the flowers are small and clustered. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
